job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join us in Amsterdam. I n this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing complex data pipelines to process transactional and ot her data . Y ou will collaborate closely w ith data scientists and analysts in developing and maintaining data solutions and INGA's data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.
   We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills. We hire people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time in Amsterdam. Come join us!

   A working day in the life of a Data Engineer
   A typical day for a data engineer s tarts with coffee, catching up with colleagues, and drafting a plan for the coming day. A fter the standup , you will start e xploring the data to solve business problems, building and maintaining the production-ready infrastructure , and building the data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate data from disparate sources. Being an advocate for best practices in data engineering is important while working on such task s .
   After lunch, you organized a knowledge - sharing session to explain data security, compli a nce, and privacy standards to the rest of the data engineering team. Finally, to wrap up the day, you collaborated with the data science and analysts' teams to develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning., We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
job_details.full_text:
Data Engineer SATM

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join us in Amsterdam. I n this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing complex data pipelines to process transactional and ot her data . Y ou will collaborate closely w ith data scientists and analysts in developing and maintaining data solutions and INGA's data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.
   We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills. We hire people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time in Amsterdam. Come join us!

   A working day in the life of a Data Engineer
   A typical day for a data engineer s tarts with coffee, catching up with colleagues, and drafting a plan for the coming day. A fter the standup , you will start e xploring the data to solve business problems, building and maintaining the production-ready infrastructure , and building the data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate data from disparate sources. Being an advocate for best practices in data engineering is important while working on such task s .
   After lunch, you organized a knowledge - sharing session to explain data security, compli a nce, and privacy standards to the rest of the data engineering team. Finally, to wrap up the day, you collaborated with the data science and analysts' teams to develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning., We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional data engineering tasks such as designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines, data cleaning, transformation, and aggregation. While it mentions collaboration with data scientists and the development of data models for machine learning, it does not detail specific involvement in building, fine-tuning, or deploying generative AI models, nor does it emphasize advanced prompt engineering, RAG systems, or PEFT. The core responsibilities and technologies described align more with a Data Engineer role rather than a GenAI Engineer or ML Engineer, and the role is not primarily focused on AI model development itself. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's a technical role but not specifically an AI/ML engineering role as defined in the Coding Book.

job_tasks.phrase: designing, building, and optimizing complex data pipelines to process transactional and other data

job_tasks.phrase: Being an advocate for best practices in data engineering

job_tasks.phrase: develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning

job_tasks.phrase: exploring the data to solve business problems

job_tasks.phrase: collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts

job_tasks.phrase: committed to developing themselves and learning new skills

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Keep learning' is a direct instruction and expectation for continuous skill development.
The phrase 'Take on responsibility' implies a proactive approach and ownership of tasks and outcomes.
The phrase 'data security, compliance, and privacy standards' highlights an awareness of ethical and legal considerations in data handling.
job_tasks.phrase: data security, compliance, and privacy standards
